container.p: In some cases, where you put elements matters, and XforJ will refuse to compile if elements are found in the wrong location. The best way to get familiar with this placement is to study the .
Attributes are given in the order that they may appear.
Here is a high level overview of element restrictions at the file level:

ol.li: namespace must appear first in the file (before any whitespace).
import statements may appear after the namespace and before any var declarations.
var declarations may appear after import and before template declarations.
template may appear any number of times after var declarations.
